_header: As Holy Church teacheth thee thine alms hide and lay
Note: For macaronic heading of six short lines: ‘Man with good…’, see 3392.
_description: On the duty of Almsgiving — seven quatrains

RylandsLat395.First Lines:
As holy Chirche techith the thyne almes hide & layeIn þe
                    pour mannys bosom and it will for the prayeAs watir fire quenchith so almes
                    doth synne allayeGeve thyne almes thou shalt encres god hymself doth
                    saye…
RylandsLat395.Last Lines:
…In myserable penury fayne to begg his bredeA man not knowyng
                    his honour is a beste in dede
RylandsLat395.Note:
Bound with 
            All Ouids elegies 3. bookes. By C.M. Epigrams by I.D., At Middlebourgh [i.e. London: s.n., ca.
            1630] .
RylandsLat395.Editions:
Brydges,  Sir Samuel Egerton. 
             Censura Literaria.
         10 vols. London: Longman, 1805-09; 2nd ed., 1815: 10.69-70.
